entities.creatures

Class Creature

  • java.lang.Object
    • entities.Entity
      • entities.creatures.Creature
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Mob, Player

    public abstract class Creature
extends Entity
    A Creature is an Entity that can engage in combat, move, and drop items upon death. As such they are the player's primary item resource.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Creature

        public Creature(java.lang.String name,
                java.lang.String examineText,
                float x,
                float y,

      • Creature

        public Creature(java.lang.String name,
                java.lang.String examineText,
                float x,
                float y,
                int startingHealth,
                int attackDamage,
                float speed)
        Creates a new Creature instance with the specified information.
        Parameters:
        name - The creature's name.
        examineText - The creature's examination text.
        x - The creature's starting x coordinate.
        y - The creature's starting y coordinate.
        startingHealth - The creature's starting health. This will be the creature's maximum health.
        attackDamage - The creature's basic attack
        speed - The creature's movement speed.

    • Method Detail

      • attack

        public int attack()
        Gets the damage that a creature deals. By default, creatures always deal the same damage amount. Other behavior should be specified by subclasses.
        Returns:
        The damage this creature deals.

      • checkCollision

        public boolean checkCollision(float deltaX,
                              float deltaY)
        Checks in a specific direction if collisions are happening between the moving creature and other entities, or solid tiles, at the 3 closest tiles in front of the creature.
        Parameters:
        deltaX - The horizontal position change.
        deltaY - The vertical position change.
        Returns:
        true if it collides and false if it doesn't.

      • checkCollisionInTile

        public boolean checkCollisionInTile(Tile tile,
                                    float deltaX,
                                    float deltaY,
                                    int dir)
        checks collision with a creature in the given tile and and creature
        Parameters:
        tile - The tile to be checked.
        deltaX - The horizontal position change.
        deltaY - The vertical position change.
        dir - 1 if its moving vertically or 0 if horizontally
        Returns:
        true if it collides and false if it doesn't

      • checkCollisionWithTile

        public boolean checkCollisionWithTile(float x,
                                      float y,
                                      float deltaX,
                                      float deltaY,
                                      int dir)
        checks collision with the given tile and and creature
        Parameters:
        x - The tile's horizontal position.
        y - The tile's vertical position.
        deltaX - The horizontal position change.
        deltaY - The vertical position change.
        dir - 1 if its moving vertically or 0 if horizontally
        Returns:
        true if the creature would collide in the specified circumstances.

      • getHealth

        public int getHealth()

        public float getSpeed()

        public boolean isDead()

      • move

        public MoveResult move(Direction d)
        Moves this Creature in the specified Direction, if the World allows it.
        Parameters:
        d - A Direction: UP, DOWN, LEFT or RIGHT.
        Returns:
        A member of MoveResult to inform the result of the movement attempt.

      • processMovement

        private MoveResult processMovement(float deltaX,
                                   float deltaY)
        Validates the Creature can move in the direction specified and actually moves it if it is allowed to.
        Parameters:
        deltaX - The horizontal position change.
        deltaY - The vertical position change.
        Returns:
        MoveResult.CHANGED_TILE if this Creature moved and changed Tile, MoveResult.MOVED_WITHIN_TILE if this Creature moved but didn't change tile, or MoveResult.CANT_MOVE if the Creature couldn't move (either due to a collision with another Entity or with a solid Tile).

      • readObject

        private void readObject(java.io.ObjectInputStream in)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Un-serializes this object following default behavior.
        Parameters:
        in - The Stream to read this Entity from.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs while reading from the Stream.
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - If an invalid class was read from the Stream.

      • receiveDamage

        public int receiveDamage(int damage)
        Damages this Creature the specified damage amount and returns the Creature's life after being hit.
        Parameters:
        damage - The amount of damage taken.
        Returns:
        The Creature's health after receiving damage.

      • setHealth

        protected void setHealth(int newHealth)

        public void setSpeed(float newSpeed)

      • update

        public abstract void update()
        Description copied from class: Entity
        An Entity can have behavior to update as the game progresses. Each subclass should specify its own behavior, if any.
        Specified by:
        update in class Entity
        See Also:
        Entity.update()

                  throws java.io.IOException
        Serializes this object following default behavior.
        Parameters:
        out - The Stream to write this Entity to.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs while writing to the Stream.
